00030 /* absolute value */
00031 template < class T >
00032 inline T
00033 ABS( T a )
00034 { return (0 < a) ? a : -a ; }

00123 // basic inlined vector class
00124 template<class Scalar>
00125 class ntlVector3Dim
00126 {
00127 public:
00128   // Constructor
00129   inline ntlVector3Dim(void );
00130   // Copy-Constructor
00131   inline ntlVector3Dim(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &v );
00132   inline ntlVector3Dim(const float *);
00133   inline ntlVector3Dim(const double *);
00134   // construct a vector from one Scalar
00135   inline ntlVector3Dim(Scalar);
00136   // construct a vector from three Scalars
00137   inline ntlVector3Dim(Scalar, Scalar, Scalar);
00138 
00139     // get address of array for OpenGL
00140     Scalar *getAddress() { return value; }
00141 
00142   // Assignment operator
00143   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator=  (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& v);
00144   // Assignment operator
00145   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator=  (Scalar s);
00146   // Assign and add operator
00147   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator+= (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& v);
00148   // Assign and add operator
00149   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator+= (Scalar s);
00150   // Assign and sub operator
00151   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator-= (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& v);
00152   // Assign and sub operator
00153   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator-= (Scalar s);
00154   // Assign and mult operator
00155   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator*= (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& v);
00156   // Assign and mult operator
00157   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator*= (Scalar s);
00158   // Assign and div operator
00159   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator/= (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& v);
00160   // Assign and div operator
00161   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& operator/= (Scalar s);
00162 
00163 
00164   // unary operator
00165   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator- () const;
00166 
00167   // binary operator add
00168   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator+ (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>&) const;
00169   // binary operator add
00170   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator+ (Scalar) const;
00171   // binary operator sub
00172   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator- (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>&) const;
00173   // binary operator sub
00174   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator- (Scalar) const;
00175   // binary operator mult
00176   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator* (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>&) const;
00177   // binary operator mult
00178   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator* (Scalar) const;
00179   // binary operator div
00180   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator/ (const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>&) const;
00181   // binary operator div
00182   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> operator/ (Scalar) const;
00183 
00184   // Projection normal to a vector
00185   inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>    getOrthogonalntlVector3Dim() const;
00186   // Project into a plane
00187   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& projectNormalTo(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &v);
00188   
00189   // minimize
00190   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &minimize(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &);
00191   // maximize
00192   inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &maximize(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &);
00193   
00194   // access operator
00195   inline Scalar& operator[](unsigned int i);
00196   // access operator
00197   inline const Scalar& operator[](unsigned int i) const;
00198 
00199 protected:
00200   
00201 private:
00202   Scalar value[3];  //< Storage of vector values
00203 };

00215 extern const char *globVecFormatStr;
00216 
00217 /*************************************************************************
00218   Outputs the object in human readable form using the format
00219   [x,y,z]
00220   */
00221 template<class Scalar>
00222 std::ostream&
00223 operator<<( std::ostream& os, const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& i )
00224 {
00225     char buf[256];
00226     snprintf(buf,256,globVecFormatStr,i[0],i[1],i[2]);
00227     os << string(buf); 
00228   //os << '[' << i[0] << ", " << i[1] << ", " << i[2] << ']';
00229   return os;
00230 }
00231 
00232 
00233 
00234 /*************************************************************************
00235   Reads the contents of the object from a stream using the same format
00236   as the output operator.
00237   */
00238 template<class Scalar>
00239 std::istream&
00240 operator>>( std::istream& is, ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>& i )
00241 {
00242   char c;
00243   char dummy[3];
00244   is >> c >> i[0] >> dummy >> i[1] >> dummy >> i[2] >> c;
00245   return is;
00246 }

00676 
00677 
00678 /*************************************************************************
00679   Compute the scalar product with another vector.
00680   \param v The second vector to work with
00681   \return The value of the scalar product
00682   */
00683 template<class Scalar>
00684 inline Scalar dot(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &t, const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &v )
00685 {
00686   //return t.value[0]*v.value[0] + t.value[1]*v.value[1] + t.value[2]*v.value[2];
00687   return ((t[0]*v[0]) + (t[1]*v[1]) + (t[2]*v[2]));
00688 }
00689 
00690 
00691 /*************************************************************************
00692   Calculate the cross product of this and another vector
00693  */
00694 template<class Scalar>
00695 inline ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> cross(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &t, const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &v)
00696 {
00697   ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> cp( 
00698             ((t[1]*v[2]) - (t[2]*v[1])),
00699           ((t[2]*v[0]) - (t[0]*v[2])),
00700           ((t[0]*v[1]) - (t[1]*v[0])) );
00701   return cp;
00702 }
00703 
00704 
00705 
00706 
00707 /*************************************************************************
00708   Compute a vector that is orthonormal to self. Nothing else can be assumed
00709   for the direction of the new vector.
00710   \return The orthonormal vector
00711   */
00712 template<class Scalar>
00713 ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>
00714 ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>::getOrthogonalntlVector3Dim() const
00715 {
00716   // Determine the  component with max. absolute value
00717   int max= (fabs(value[0]) > fabs(value[1])) ? 0 : 1;
00718   max= (fabs(value[max]) > fabs(value[2])) ? max : 2;
00719 
00720   /*************************************************************************
00721     Choose another axis than the one with max. component and project
00722     orthogonal to self
00723     */
00724   ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> vec(0.0);
00725   vec[(max+1)%3]= 1;
00726   vec.normalize();
00727   vec.projectNormalTo(this->getNormalized());
00728   return vec;
00729 }
00730 
00731 
00732 /*************************************************************************
00733   Projects the vector into a plane normal to the given vector, which must
00734   have unit length. Self is modified.
00735   \param v The plane normal
00736   \return The projected vector
00737   */
00738 template<class Scalar>
00739 inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>&
00740 ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>::projectNormalTo(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &v)
00741 {
00742   Scalar sprod = dot(*this,v);
00743   value[0]= value[0] - v.value[0] * sprod;
00744   value[1]= value[1] - v.value[1] * sprod;
00745   value[2]= value[2] - v.value[2] * sprod;  
00746   return *this;
00747 }
00748

00752 // Other helper functions
00753 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00756 
00757 /*************************************************************************
00758   Minimize the vector, i.e. set each entry of the vector to the minimum
00759   of both values.
00760   \param pnt The second vector to compare with
00761   \return Reference to the modified self
00762   */
00763 template<class Scalar>
00764 inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &
00765 ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>::minimize(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &pnt)
00766 {
00767   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00768     value[i] = MIN(value[i],pnt[i]);
00769   return *this;
00770 }
00771 
00772 
00773 
00774 /*************************************************************************
00775   Maximize the vector, i.e. set each entry of the vector to the maximum
00776   of both values.
00777   \param pnt The second vector to compare with
00778   \return Reference to the modified self
00779   */
00780 template<class Scalar>
00781 inline const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &
00782 ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>::maximize(const ntlVector3Dim<Scalar> &pnt)
00783 {
00784   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00785     value[i] = MAX(value[i],pnt[i]);
00786   return *this;
00787 }

00794 // a 3D vector with double precision
00795 typedef ntlVector3Dim<double>  ntlVec3d; 
00796 
00797 // a 3D vector with single precision
00798 typedef ntlVector3Dim<float>   ntlVec3f; 
00799 
00800 // a 3D integer vector
00801 typedef ntlVector3Dim<int>     ntlVec3i; 
00802 
00803 // Color uses single precision fp values
00804 typedef ntlVec3f ntlColor;
00805 
00806 /* convert a float to double vector */
00807 template<class T> inline ntlVec3d vec2D(T v) { return ntlVec3d(v[0],v[1],v[2]); }
00808 template<class T> inline ntlVec3f vec2F(T v) { return ntlVec3f(v[0],v[1],v[2]); }
00809 template<class T> inline ntlColor vec2Col(T v) { return ntlColor(v[0],v[1],v[2]); }

00812 
00813 /************************************************************************/
00814 // graphics vector typing
00815 
00816 
00817 // use which fp-precision for raytracing? 1=float, 2=double
00818 
00819 /* VECTOR_EPSILON is the minimal vector length
00820    In order to be able to discriminate floating point values near zero, and
00821    to be sure not to fail a comparison because of roundoff errors, use this
00822    value as a threshold.  */
00823 
00824 // use which fp-precision for graphics? 1=float, 2=double
00825 #ifdef PRECISION_GFX_SINGLE
00826 #define GFX_PRECISION 1
00827 #else
00828 #ifdef PRECISION_GFX_DOUBLE
00829 #define GFX_PRECISION 2
00830 #else
00831 // standard precision for graphics 
00832 #ifndef GFX_PRECISION
00833 #define GFX_PRECISION 1
00834 #endif
00835 #endif
00836 #endif
00837         
00838 #if GFX_PRECISION==1
00839 typedef float gfxReal;
00840 #define GFX_REAL_MAX __FLT_MAX__
00841 //#define vecF2Gfx(x) (x)
00842 //#define vecGfx2F(x) (x)
00843 //#define vecD2Gfx(x) vecD2F(x)
00844 //#define vecGfx2D(x) vecF2D(x)
00845 #define VECTOR_EPSILON (1e-5f)
00846 #else
00847 typedef double gfxReal;
00848 #define GFX_REAL_MAX __DBL_MAX__
00849 //#define vecF2Gfx(x) vecD2F(x)
00850 //#define vecGfx2F(x) vecF2D(x)
00851 //#define vecD2Gfx(x) (x)
00852 //#define vecGfx2D(x) (x)
00853 #define VECTOR_EPSILON (1e-10)
00854 #endif
00855 
00856 /* fixed double prec. type, for epxlicitly double values */
00857 typedef double gfxDouble;
00858 
00859 // a 3D vector for graphics output, typically float?
00860 typedef ntlVector3Dim<gfxReal>  ntlVec3Gfx; 
00861 
00862 template<class T> inline ntlVec3Gfx vec2G(T v) { return ntlVec3Gfx(v[0],v[1],v[2]); }
00863 
00864 /* get minimal vector length value that can be discriminated.  */
00865 //inline double getVecEpsilon() { return (double)VECTOR_EPSILON; }
00866 inline gfxReal getVecEpsilon() { return (gfxReal)VECTOR_EPSILON; }
00867 
00868 #define HAVE_GFXTYPES

00871 
00872 
00873 /************************************************************************/
00874 // HELPER FUNCTIONS, independent of implementation
00875 /************************************************************************/
00876 
00877 #define VECTOR_TYPE ntlVector3Dim<Scalar>
00878 
00879 
00880 /*************************************************************************
00881   Compute the length (norm) of the vector.
00882   \return The value of the norm
00883   */
00884 template<class Scalar>
00885 inline Scalar norm( const VECTOR_TYPE &v)
00886 {
00887   Scalar l = v[0]*v[0] + v[1]*v[1] + v[2]*v[2];
00888   return (fabs(l-1.) < VECTOR_EPSILON*VECTOR_EPSILON) ? 1. : sqrt(l);
00889 }
00890 
00891 
00892 /*************************************************************************
00893   Same as getNorm but doesnt sqrt  
00894   */
00895 template<class Scalar>
00896 inline Scalar normNoSqrt( const VECTOR_TYPE &v)
00897 {
00898   return v[0]*v[0] + v[1]*v[1] + v[2]*v[2];
00899 }
00900 
00901 
00902 /*************************************************************************
00903   Compute a normalized vector based on this vector.
00904   \return The new normalized vector
00905   */
00906 template<class Scalar>
00907 inline VECTOR_TYPE getNormalized( const VECTOR_TYPE &v)
00908 {
00909   Scalar l = v[0]*v[0] + v[1]*v[1] + v[2]*v[2];
00910   if (fabs(l-1.) < VECTOR_EPSILON*VECTOR_EPSILON)
00911     return v; /* normalized "enough"... */
00912   else if (l > VECTOR_EPSILON*VECTOR_EPSILON)
00913   {
00914     Scalar fac = 1./sqrt(l);
00915     return VECTOR_TYPE(v[0]*fac, v[1]*fac, v[2]*fac);
00916   }
00917   else
00918     return VECTOR_TYPE((Scalar)0);
00919 }
00920 
00921 
00922 /*************************************************************************
00923   Compute the norm of the vector and normalize it.
00924   \return The value of the norm
00925   */
00926 template<class Scalar>
00927 inline Scalar normalize( VECTOR_TYPE &v) 
00928 {
00929   Scalar norm;
00930   Scalar l = v[0]*v[0] + v[1]*v[1] + v[2]*v[2];  
00931   if (fabs(l-1.) < VECTOR_EPSILON*VECTOR_EPSILON) {
00932     norm = 1.;
00933     } else if (l > VECTOR_EPSILON*VECTOR_EPSILON) {
00934     norm = sqrt(l);
00935     Scalar fac = 1./norm;
00936     v[0] *= fac;
00937     v[1] *= fac;
00938     v[2] *= fac; 
00939     } else {
00940     v[0]= v[1]= v[2]= 0;
00941     norm = 0.;
00942   }
00943   return (Scalar)norm;
00944 }
00945 
00946 
00947 /*************************************************************************
00948   Compute a vector, that is self (as an incoming
00949   vector) reflected at a surface with a distinct normal vector. Note
00950   that the normal is reversed, if the scalar product with it is positive.
00951   \param n The surface normal
00952   \return The new reflected vector
00953   */
00954 template<class Scalar>
00955 inline VECTOR_TYPE reflectVector(const VECTOR_TYPE &t, const VECTOR_TYPE &n) 
00956 {
00957   VECTOR_TYPE nn= (dot(t, n) > 0.0) ? (n*-1.0) : n;
00958   return ( t - nn * (2.0 * dot(nn, t)) );
00959 }
00960 
00961 
00962 
00963 /*************************************************************************
00964  * My own refraction calculation
00965  * Taken from Glassner's book, section 5.2 (Heckberts method)
00966  */
00967 template<class Scalar>
00968 inline VECTOR_TYPE refractVector(const VECTOR_TYPE &t, const VECTOR_TYPE &normal, Scalar nt, Scalar nair, int &refRefl) 
00969 {
00970     Scalar eta = nair / nt;
00971     Scalar n = -dot(t, normal);
00972     Scalar tt = 1.0 + eta*eta* (n*n-1.0);
00973     if(tt<0.0) {
00974         // we have total reflection!
00975         refRefl = 1;
00976     } else {
00977         // normal reflection
00978         tt = eta*n - sqrt(tt);
00979         return( t*eta + normal*tt );
00980     }
00981     return t;
00982 }
00983     /*double eta = nair / nt;
00984     double n = -((*this) | normal);
00985     double t = 1.0 + eta*eta* (n*n-1.0);
00986     if(t<0.0) {
00987         // we have total reflection!
00988         refRefl = 1;
00989     } else {
00990         // normal reflection
00991         t = eta*n - sqrt(t);
00992         return( (*this)*eta + normal*t );
00993     }
00994     return (*this);*/
00995 
00996 
00997 /*************************************************************************
00998   Test two ntlVector3Dims for equality based on the equality of their
00999   values within a small threshold.
01000   \param c The second vector to compare
01001   \return TRUE if both are equal
01002   \sa getEpsilon()
01003   */
01004 template<class Scalar>
01005 inline bool equal(const VECTOR_TYPE &v, const VECTOR_TYPE &c)
01006 {
01007   return (ABS(v[0]-c[0]) + 
01008       ABS(v[1]-c[1]) + 
01009       ABS(v[2]-c[2]) < VECTOR_EPSILON);
01010 }
01011 
01012 
01013 /*************************************************************************
01014  * Assume this vector is an RGB color, and convert it to HSV
01015  */
01016 template<class Scalar>
01017 inline void rgbToHsv( VECTOR_TYPE &V )
01018 {
01019     Scalar h=0,s=0,v=0;
01020     Scalar maxrgb, minrgb, delta;
01021     // convert to hsv...
01022     maxrgb = V[0];
01023     int maxindex = 1;
01024     if(V[2] > maxrgb){ maxrgb = V[2]; maxindex = 2; }
01025     if(V[1] > maxrgb){ maxrgb = V[1]; maxindex = 3; }
01026     minrgb = V[0];
01027     if(V[2] < minrgb) minrgb = V[2];
01028     if(V[1] < minrgb) minrgb = V[1];
01029 
01030     v = maxrgb;
01031     delta = maxrgb-minrgb;
01032 
01033     if(maxrgb > 0) s = delta/maxrgb;
01034     else s = 0;
01035 
01036     h = 0;
01037     if(s > 0) {
01038         if(maxindex == 1) {
01039             h = ((V[1]-V[2])/delta)  + 0.0; }
01040         if(maxindex == 2) {
01041             h = ((V[2]-V[0])/delta)  + 2.0; }
01042         if(maxindex == 3) {
01043             h = ((V[0]-V[1])/delta)  + 4.0; }
01044         h *= 60.0;
01045         if(h < 0.0) h += 360.0;
01046     }
01047 
01048     V[0] = h;
01049     V[1] = s;
01050     V[2] = v;
01051 }
01052 
01053 /*************************************************************************
01054  * Assume this vector is HSV and convert to RGB
01055  */
01056 template<class Scalar>
01057 inline void hsvToRgb( VECTOR_TYPE &V )
01058 {
01059     Scalar h = V[0], s = V[1], v = V[2];
01060     Scalar r=0,g=0,b=0;
01061     Scalar p,q,t, fracth;
01062     int floorh;
01063     // ...and back to rgb
01064     if(s == 0) {
01065         r = g = b = v; }
01066     else {
01067         h /= 60.0;
01068         floorh = (int)h;
01069         fracth = h - floorh;
01070         p = v * (1.0 - s);
01071         q = v * (1.0 - (s * fracth));
01072         t = v * (1.0 - (s * (1.0 - fracth)));
01073         switch (floorh) {
01074         case 0: r = v; g = t; b = p; break;
01075         case 1: r = q; g = v; b = p; break;
01076         case 2: r = p; g = v; b = t; break;
01077         case 3: r = p; g = q; b = v; break;
01078         case 4: r = t; g = p; b = v; break;
01079         case 5: r = v; g = p; b = q; break;
01080         }
01081     }
01082 
01083     V[0] = r;
01084     V[1] = g;
01085     V[2] = b;
01086 }
01087 
01088

01091 #endif /* NTL_VECTOR3DIM_HH */
